page.title: 01Rural Southeast Cheshire
page.content: In this area the land is primarily used for cattle, but there are also many potatoes grown. There are also an increasing number of fields used for horticultural crops, growing shrubs, trees & herbaceous plants for the nearby Bridgemere Nursery. Although the O.S. map refers to Parrah Green, the village is known as Bridgemere. There is a wildlife park here, which has many wild animals & birds, both from this country & abroad, enclosed & on show to the public. Until last year Doddington Hall was a private school known as Goudhurst College; it is currently unused, but an application for change of use to offices has just been granted. Bridgemere has a primary school with a roll of sixty-four children.
